intro: Bonifazia quezalteca, commonly known as the Quezalteca orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the high-altitude cloud forests of Guatemala. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows on tree trunks or rocks, exhibiting epiphytic growth habits. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its humid, shaded environment. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
